context.p: The first step in providing services for AWSROROpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure is to create one or more technical services.

step.cmd: Define one or more technical services in an XML file.

info.p: As a basis, you can use the technical service definitions which are included in the oscm-ror-install-pack.zip file:

ul.li: samples/TechnicalService_VirtualPlatform.xml for the provisioning of virtual platforms with one or more virtual servers
samples/TechnicalService_VirtualServer.xml for the provisioning of a virtual server on an existing virtual platform

info.p: The AWS integration package, oscm-aws-install-pack.zip, includes a technical service as a sample. Use the sample as a basis for defining your own technical services as required:
The OpenStack integration package, oscm-openstack-install-pack.zip, includes technical services as samples:

ul.li: samples/TechnicalService_OpenStack.xml for native OpenStack
samples/TechnicalService_K5.xml for FUJITSU Cloud Service K5

info.p: The technical services specify sample templates as parameter options. The sample templates are also included in the oscm-openstack-install-pack.zip file:

ul.li: samples/template.json for a template of type AWS CloudFormation for native OpenStack
samples/template.yaml for a template of type Heat Orchestration Template for native OpenStack
samples/template_k5.yaml for a template of type Heat Orchestration Template for FUJITSU Cloud Service K5

info.p: You can use the samples to see how templates are mapped to technical service definitions. Copy the sample files to a location of your choice that can be reached from by HTTP or HTTPS. For example, you could copy them to the docroot/templates directory of the app-domain domain in your application server.
The TPS5 integration package, oscm-tps5-install-pack.zip, includes a technical service as a sample. Use the sample as a basis for defining your own technical services as required:
The vSphere integration package, oscm-vmware-install-pack.zip, includes a technical service as a sample. Use the sample as a basis for defining your own technical services as required:
The Azure integration package, oscm-azure-install-pack.zip, includes a technical service as a sample:

The technical service specifies a sample Resource Manager template and parameter definition file as parameter options. These files are available in the same directory. In order to use these files or adapted versions thereof, copy them to a location hat can be accessed from and the Azure integration software by HTTP or HTTPS at runtime, for example, the docroot/templates directory of the app-domain domain in your application server.
In the technical service definition, be sure to specify:

ul.li: The asynchronous provisioning type
The direct or user access type
The direct access type
The direct access type
The direct access type
The direct access type
The direct access type
Service parameters which represent the virtual platform templates and virtual server images defined in ROR. For details on the supported service parameters, refer to .
Service parameters which represent the AMIs defined in Amazon EC2. For details on the supported service parameters, refer to .
Service parameters which correspond to the parameters specified in the template defined in OpenStack. For details on the supported service parameters, refer to .
Service parameters which represent the system templates and images defined in TPS5. For details on the supported service parameters, refer to their description in the appendix.

Service parameters which represent the VM templates defined in vSphere as well as the naming, location, and sizing parameters for the VMs to be provisioned. Service parameters also define the network setup in vSphere and the configuration of the VMs. For details on the supported service parameters, refer to .
Service parameters which match the ones specified in the given Resource Manager template and parameter definition file. For details on the supported service parameters, refer to .

p.note: Make sure that you do not specify the baseUrl attribute in the technical service definition XML file. It specifies an application's remote interface and is not needed for providing services for RORAWSOpenStackTPS5vSphereAzure.

step.cmd: Log in to the administration portal with your technology manager account.
Import the technical services you created and appoint one or more supplier organizations for them.
